intro: Choristega bahajensis, commonly known as the Bahamian starflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in moist, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
